summary: Interactive romantic-themed mobile-friendly Valentine proposal web page (HTML/CSS/JS only) with yes/no interaction, always-visible love text, and post-Yes reveal of generated love notes plus a full love letter.
architectural_notes: Use only HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript (no external frameworks).
Design should be mobile-friendly/responsive with a romantic pink-and-white color scheme.
UI includes two buttons (Yes/No) with playful evasive behavior on No.
Add a post-Yes reveal flow: success animation + show generated micro-notes and the full love letter section.
Keep love notes as small, consistently displayed UI elements (e.g., floating chips/cards) and/or persist a baseline set pre-Yes.

existing_features.title: Create a single-purpose, mobile-friendly Valentine proposal page that asks a romantic proposal question and displays short love notes/messages.
Apply a consistent romantic theme using a pink-and-white color scheme, with tasteful typography and UI styling appropriate for a Valentine proposal.

Implement interactive behavior for the “No” button so it evades interaction: on hover (desktop) and on touch-start/attempted tap (mobile), the button moves away within the visible container or shrinks to make it difficult to press.

Implement “Yes” button behavior: when clicked/tapped, show a clear, romantic confirmation state (e.g., a success message overlay/section) and hide/disable the Yes/No buttons to keep the experience single-purpose.
Make the proposal question and love notes easily customizable from a single place in the frontend code (e.g., a constants object/array), without editing multiple components/files.

Add two generated romantic static images and render them as part of the page design (served from frontend static assets, not via backend): a subtle repeating heart background texture and a central heart/envelope illustration.

Keep romantic love text visible throughout the experience (before and after answering Yes), so the page always shows at least a small set of love notes even after the success/confirmation state is displayed.

Add a long-form love letter (provided by the user) to the app’s centralized content and reveal it after the user clicks/taps Yes, formatted as a readable letter with line breaks/paragraphs and a signature.

After clicking/tapping Yes, display additional small “note/letter” elements that appear progressively (generated short love notes) with soft romantic animations (gentle fade/float), in addition to the main confirmation message.
Update the post-Yes confirmation copy to use the user-requested romantic line and ensure all user-facing text is in English.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a simple romantic Valentine proposal single-page site (HTML/CSS/JS only) with pink/white theme and mobile-friendly layout
Add interactive Yes/No buttons; make the No button evade taps/clicks (run away or shrink) especially on mobile
Include short customizable love notes/messages expressing how special she is
Ensure romantic love text/notes are always visible on the page (not disappearing), with small note styling
After clicking Yes, reveal additional generated small love notes and display a full love letter message with a sweet success animation
Include a customizable long-form love letter section (provided text) as part of the page content, revealed after Yes

projectName: Romantic Valentine Proposal Single-Page Experience with Interactive Yes/No Buttons
